# The `Evaluator` Class Reference

<DoxygenPage pluginConfig={pluginConfig}>

This class evaluates LLVM IR, producing the <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/constant">Constant</a> representing each SSA instruction. <a href="#details">More...</a>

## Declaration

<CodeBlock>class llvm::Evaluator</CodeBlock>

## Description {#details}

This class evaluates LLVM IR, producing the <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/constant">Constant</a> representing each SSA instruction.

Changes to global variables are stored in a mapping that can be iterated over after the evaluation is complete. Once an evaluation call fails, the evaluation object should not be reused.

Definition at line 37 of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/transforms/include/llvm/transforms/utils/evaluator-h">Evaluator.h</a>.

### EvaluateBlock() {#a0ff865cf80810ece1fc1ac6b6f441d0f}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>bool Evaluator::EvaluateBlock (<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/basicblock/#a98c0a84a5dfa8bce341c829709f171e5">BasicBlock::iterator</a> CurInst, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/basicblock">BasicBlock</a> &#42;&amp; NextBB, bool &amp; StrippedPointerCastsForAliasAnalysis)</>}>
Evaluate all instructions in block BB, returning true if successful, false if we can&#39;t evaluate it.

NewBB returns the next BB that control flows into, or null upon return. StrippedPointerCastsForAliasAnalysis is set to true if we looked through pointer casts to evaluate something.

## Private Member Attributes

### AllocaTmps {#a4ecc9abb3893c078b52a38a02bbc89ec}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>SmallVector&lt;std::unique&#95;ptr&lt;GlobalVariable&gt;, 32&gt; llvm::Evaluator::AllocaTmps</>}>
To &#39;execute&#39; an alloca, we create a temporary global variable to represent its body.

This vector is needed so we can delete the temporary globals when we are done.

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/transforms/include/llvm/transforms/utils/evaluator-h/#l00158">158</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/transforms/include/llvm/transforms/utils/evaluator-h">Evaluator.h</a>.

### CallStack {#ae8d047bd13669c2be48d2d0dd4d935db}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>SmallVector&lt;Function&#42;, 4&gt; llvm::Evaluator::CallStack</>}>
This is used to detect recursion.

In pathological situations we could hit exponential behavior, but at least there is nothing unbounded.

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/transforms/include/llvm/transforms/utils/evaluator-h/#l00148">148</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/transforms/include/llvm/transforms/utils/evaluator-h">Evaluator.h</a>.

### MutatedMemory {#a8d5c99417bea0871158771d8edc53179}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>DenseMap&lt;GlobalVariable &#42;, MutableValue&gt; llvm::Evaluator::MutatedMemory</>}>
For each store we execute, we update this map.

Loads check this to get the most up-to-date value. If evaluation is successful, this state is committed to the process.

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/transforms/include/llvm/transforms/utils/evaluator-h/#l00153">153</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/transforms/include/llvm/transforms/utils/evaluator-h">Evaluator.h</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>SmallPtrSet&lt;Constant&#42;, 8&gt; llvm::Evaluator::SimpleConstants</>}>
These are constants we have checked and know to be simple enough to live in a static initializer of a global.

### ValueStack {#ad22579def00e85bded7c488b1bf2dca6}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>std::deque&lt;DenseMap&lt;Value&#42;, Constant&#42;&gt; &gt; llvm::Evaluator::ValueStack</>}>
As we compute SSA register values, we store their contents here.

The back of the deque contains the current function and the stack contains the values in the calling frames.
